trans-unit.source: Infers an XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) schema from an XML document.
The <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference"></xref> class cannot be inherited.
Do not use schemas from unknown or untrusted sources or locations.
Doing so will compromise the security of your code.
XML schemas (including inline schemas) are inherently vulnerable to denial of service attacks; do not accept them in untrusted scenarios.
Schema validation error messages and exceptions may expose sensitive information about the content model or URI paths to the schema file.
Be careful not to expose this information to untrusted callers.

The <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference> class in the <xref:System.Xml.Schema?displayProperty=fullName> namespace allows you to infer an XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) schema from the structure of an XML document.
The <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference> class outputs an XML schema that can validate the XML document.
The <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference> class supports the W3C XML and XML Schemas standards.
It can be used to infer a new schema or to refine an existing schema.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference"></xref> class.
Infers an XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) schema from the XML document contained in the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> object specified.

The <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.InferSchema%2A> method infers one or more W3C XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) schemas from the XML instance document contained in the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object specified.
If the XML document contains elements and attributes from multiple namespaces, then multiple schemas are generated: one for each namespace used in the document.
The primary schema is the schema that can validate the entire XML document, and its target namespace is the same as the namespace of the document element of the XML document.
The following are important notes to consider when using the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.InferSchema%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.InferSchema%2A> method ignores any `xsi:type`, `xsi:schemaLocation`, or `xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation` attributes in the XML document.
If the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object is typed, the type information it contains is ignored.
If the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object is positioned on an element that is not the root element of the XML document, a schema is inferred for only that element.

If the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object is not positioned on an element, the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.Read%2A> method is called on the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> parameter until an element is encountered (for example, when <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.NodeType%2A> is <xref:System.Xml.XmlNodeType.Element>).
At this point, the inference process starts from that element.
If no element is encountered until the end of the document, an <xref:System.ArgumentException> is thrown.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> object containing the XML document to infer a schema from.
An <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSet"></xref> object containing the inferred schemas.
The XML document is not well-formed.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> object is not positioned on the root node or on an element.
An error occurs during the schema inference process.

Infers an XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) schema from the XML document contained in the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> object specified, and refines the inferred schema using an existing schema in the <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSet"></xref> object specified with the same target namespace.

The <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.InferSchema%2A> method infers one or more W3C XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) schemas from the XML instance document contained in the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object specified.
If the XML document contains elements and attributes from multiple namespaces, multiple schemas are generated: one for each namespace used in the document.
The primary schema is the schema that can validate the entire XML document, and its target namespace is the same as the namespace of the document element of the XML document.
The following are important notes to consider when using the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.InferSchema%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.InferSchema%2A> method ignores any `xsi:type`, `xsi:schemaLocation`, or `xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation` attributes in the XML document.
If the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object is typed, the type information it contains is ignored.
If the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object is positioned on an element that is not the root element of the XML document, a schema is inferred for only that element.

If the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object is not positioned on an element, the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.Read%2A> method is called on the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> parameter until an element is encountered (for example, when <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.NodeType%2A> is <xref:System.Xml.XmlNodeType.Element>).
At this point, the inference process starts from that element.
If no element is encountered until the end of the document, an <xref:System.ArgumentException> is thrown.

If an <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSet> object is passed as a parameter and the element upon which the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object is positioned is defined in one of the schemas in the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSet>, the inferred schema is used to refine an existing schema in the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSet> parameter with the same target namespace; otherwise, a new schema is inferred for the namespace.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> object containing the XML document to infer a schema from.
An <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSet"></xref> object containing an existing schema used to refine the inferred schema.
An <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSet"></xref> object containing the inferred schemas.
The XML document is not well-formed.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> object is not positioned on the root node or on an element.
An error occurs during the schema inference process.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.InferenceOption"></xref> value that affects schema occurrence declarations inferred from the XML document.

If the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.Occurrence%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.InferenceOption.Restricted>, the first time elements are encountered in the XML document, the schema declaration is inferred as `minOccurs="1"`.
When attributes are encountered, the schema declaration is inferred as `use="required"`.

If the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.Occurrence%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.InferenceOption.Relaxed>, element schema declarations are inferred as `minOccurs="0"`, and attribute schema declarations are inferred as `use="optional"`.
The default value of the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.Occurrence%2A> property is <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.InferenceOption.Restricted>.
An <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.InferenceOption"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.InferenceOption"></xref> value that affects types inferred from the XML document.

If the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.TypeInference%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.InferenceOption.Relaxed>, the inferred type of elements and attributes in the XML document with simple content is always `xs:string`.

If the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.TypeInference%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.InferenceOption.Restricted>, more specific types are inferred, such as `xs:date`, `xs:decimal`, `xs:unsignedByte`, and so on.
The default value of the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.TypeInference%2A> property is <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.InferenceOption.Restricted>.
An <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInference.InferenceOption"></xref> object.
